intro: [WRONG START] Hieracius subexcelsius, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and yellow composite flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It has slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Hieracium subexcelsius is native to Europe and has been introduced to other regions, where it can become invasive in certain ecosystems.
